comment.text: This translation key is used to display a label for rooms that can only be viewed, typically in a filtering or search interface. It appears as a filter option on pages like the Home page's Filter section, allowing users to select view-only rooms. Translators should aim for an accurate and descriptive phrase that maintains the intended accessibility and functionality of the UI component.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Yalnız baxın" doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "View-only." It translates to "Just look" or "Only watch," which is too literal and doesn't reflect the restriction implied by "View-only."  "View-only" implies read-only access, not just looking.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would depend on the context. Possible suggestions include: "Yalnız oxumaq üçün" (read-only), "Sərfəli deyil redaktə etmək" (not editable), or "Ancaq baxış üçün" (for viewing only).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation "Само за преглед" while literally meaning 'Only for review', doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'View-only' which implies read-only access or viewing without modification. It lacks the implication of restriction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation might be "Само за четене" (Only for reading) or "Само за гледане" (Only for viewing), or even something like "С достъп само за четене" (With read-only access).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation "Schreibgeschützt" is technically correct but doesn't perfectly capture the nuance of "View-only." "Schreibgeschützt" implies a protection against writing, while "View-only" specifically refers to the ability to view but not modify. A more suitable translation might be "Nur-Anzeigen" or "Lesen-nur".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "Nur-Anzeigen" or "Lesen-nur" for a more precise translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Միայն դիտելու համար" is a literal translation of "View-only", it's not the most natural or concise way to express the concept in Armenian. It sounds slightly clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more idiomatic translation like "Միայն դիտողական" (Miayn ditoghakan) or "Դիտողական" (Ditoghakan). The best option depends on the context and intended nuance.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ເບິ່ງເທົ່ານັ້ນ' (beng thaonan) literally translates to 'view only' but might not perfectly convey the intended meaning of 'View-only' which implies a permission or access level. It doesn't necessarily communicate that it's a restricted view.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a translation that better conveys the restriction, such as 'ເບິ່ງໄດ້ຢ່າງດຽວ' (beng dai yang diao) - 'view only/able', or 'ອະນຸຍາດໃຫ້ເບິ່ງຢ່າງດຽວ' (anuyat hai beng yang diao) - 'permitted to view only', depending on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Apenas ver" is a literal translation of "View-only" but doesn't fully capture the intended meaning. It translates to "Only see," which lacks the restriction implied by 'View-only'. A better translation would convey the concept of access limited to viewing only.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Somente visualização", "Visualização apenas", or "Acesso somente para visualização" to better reflect the English meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Doar vizualizare' while understandable, isn't the most accurate or natural translation of 'View-only'. It literally translates to 'Only viewing'. A better translation would capture the permission aspect.
'View-only' implies a restricted viewing access. 'Просмотр' simply means 'viewing' and doesn't convey the restriction. A more accurate translation would incorporate the 'only' aspect.

The Slovak translation "Iba prezeranie" while understandable, doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'View-only'. It literally translates to 'Only viewing.' A more accurate and natural translation would be 'Len na prezeranie' or 'Výhľadovo len'.

The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Само-за-преглед" does not accurately convey the meaning of "View-only". It literally translates to something like "self-for-review" which is not the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be "Само-приказ" (Samo-prikaz) or "Само-гледање" (Samo-gledanje), which both convey the idea of viewing only.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Latin) translation "Samo-za-pregled" does not accurately convey the meaning of "View-only". It's a literal and awkward construction that doesn't translate to "view-only".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be "Za pregled samo" or "Samo za pregled".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Turkish translation 'Sadece görüntüleme' is a literal translation of 'View-only' but may not be the most natural or idiomatic way to express the concept in Turkish. It's technically correct but could be improved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Yalnızca görüntüleme' or 'Sadece okunabilir' depending on the specific context. 'Yalnızca görüntüleme' is more formal and 'Sadece okunabilir' (read-only) might be more appropriate for technical documentation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "仅查看" (jin chakan) while generally meaning 'view only', doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'View-only' in the context of rooms (likely access permission). It's accurate but could be improved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 房间仅览 (fangjian jin lan) - This more accurately implies a room that can only be viewed, a common usage for access permissions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Shikoni-vetëm' is a literal translation of 'View-only' but doesn't quite capture the intended meaning in Albanian. It feels somewhat clunky and unnatural. A more natural and accurate translation would convey the concept of being able to view but not interact with something.
